caption.p: Infectious Causes of Fever and Jaundice

tr.td:
EBV, CMV Enteric fever (typhoid and paratyphoid) Hepatitis A–E * Leptospirosis (Weil's disease) Non-typhoidal Salmonella plus HIV
P. falciparum malaria, severe Relapsing fevers ( Borrelia spp.) Septicemia, including pneumococcal sepsis Typhus Yellow fever and other viral hemorrhagic fevers

Bartonellosis Hemolytic-uremic syndrome ( Shigella spp., Escherichia coli) Malaria
Mycoplasma pneumoniae Sickle cell crisis with infective trigger

fn.p: Fever and jaundice rarely present concurrently.
